raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Centrilobular hepatocytes", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient experienced hypovolemic shock from acute lower GI bleeding, leading to hypotension and subsequent ischemic hepatitis (shock liver), as indicated by the marked elevation in AST and ALT. The centrilobular (zone 3) hepatocytes are most susceptible to hypoxic injury because they are farthest from the hepatic artery and portal vein blood supply. Therefore, these cells are damaged first in ischemic hepatitis.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
